name: Lightning Jewel Orchid
description: Macodes petola, commonly known as Lightning Jewel Orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (15-30 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive intricate vein patterns that resemble lightning bolts and precious metalwork. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Prized more for their beautiful leaves than flowers, unlike most orchids. The intricate vein patterns on leaves resemble precious metalwork, with some species having iridescent or metallic-looking patterns. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds exotic elegance with its stunning veined foliage. It's extremely popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive lightning-like vein patterns.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
